title: No 10 will have no say on which Mandelson papers are released
description: A committee of MPs and peers says the government has confirmed it will not overrule any decision to disclose files.
content:
Senior MPs and peers will have the final say on whether sensitive information is published relating to Peter Mandelson's appointment and role as US ambassador.
Parliament's Intelligence and Security Committee (ISC) said it had confirmed with the gove... [3035 chars]

title: York fish and chip shop named Britain's best
description: The Scrap Box in Dunnington wins the award from the National Federation of Fish Fryers.
content:
A fish and chip shop run by two brothers in York has been named as Britain's best - an award the owners said "every chippy dreams of".
The Scrap Box in Dunnington scooped the 2026 Takeaway of the Year at the National Fish and Chip Awards, which co-ow... [666 chars]

title: Driver who crashed while gambling on mobile is jailed after pregnant woman suffered premature birth
description: Jack Bentley admitted driving into the back of a stationary vehicle on the A50 in Derbyshire in April 2025.
content:
A driver has been jailed after crashing into the back of a car while gambling on his mobile phone, and causing a pregnant woman to go into labour.
Derby Crown Court heard Jack Bentley, 30, from Meadow Way, Derby, was seen veering into the grass verge... [2362 chars]

title: Waitrose suspends sale of mackerel because of overfishing
description: Supermarket chain says it will point customers to herring and other species to protect threatened Atlantic stocks
content:
Waitrose has become the first UK supermarket to suspend the sale of mackerel because of overfishing and will start pointing customers toward herring and other species.
The Marine Conservation Society warned last year that stocks were at breaking poin... [2827 chars]

title: Leave big tech behind! How to replace Amazon, Google, X, Meta, Apple - and more
description: A handful of companies monopolise the web, with unprecedented access to our data. But there are many more ethical – and often distinctively European – alternatives
content: There’s not much to love about big tech these days. So many ills can be laid at its door: social media harms, misinformation, polarisation, mining and misuse of personal data, environmental negligence, tax avoidance, the list goes on. Added to which,... [13194 chars]
